intro: Thapsia platycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited thapsia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in dry, rocky environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of its family. Its fruit is a dry, three-lobed capsule that splits open to release the seeds. Thapsia platycarpa is characterized by its slender stems and narrow, pinnately compound leaves.
